working_definition: Speech or Language Impairment means a communication disorder such as stuttering, impaired articulation, a language impairment, or a voice impairment that adversely affects a child’s educational performance.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Articulation Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Difficulty producing speech sounds correctly, such as substituting one sound for another.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Fluency Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Disruptions in the flow of speech, such as stuttering or prolonged sounds.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Receptive Language Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Difficulty understanding spoken language, including directions or vocabulary.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Expressive Language Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Difficulty expressing thoughts, ideas, or feelings verbally.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Voice Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Abnormal pitch, volume, or quality of the voice that distracts from communication.

common_presentations: Speaks in incomplete sentences or with limited vocabulary
Frequently asks for repetition or clarification
Speech is hard to understand due to rate, pitch, or volume
Speech patterns interfere with peer interactions
Requires support to build expressive or receptive language skills

accommodations_modifications.name: Speech therapy sessions with a licensed SLP
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Builds foundational skills in articulation, fluency, and language
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Requires support to build expressive or receptive language skills
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives 30-minute speech sessions twice a week

accommodations_modifications.name: Visual supports to aid communication
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses visual schedule and picture icons for tasks

accommodations_modifications.name: Wait time and sentence starters
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports verbal expression and reduces pressure
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher gives student 10 extra seconds and prompts like 'I think…'

accommodations_modifications.name: Frequent comprehension checks
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures student understands content and directions
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Frequently asks for repetition or clarification
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher asks student to repeat instructions back before beginning work

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of communication boards or AAC tools
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports communication when speech is limited
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Speech patterns interfere with peer interactions
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a communication app to answer questions in class

accommodations_modifications.name: Modeling correct speech in a natural context
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reinforces accurate pronunciation and syntax without correction pressure
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher repeats what the student says using correct articulation

accommodations_modifications.name: Small group or one-on-one instruction
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces anxiety and increases participation opportunities
accommodations_modifications.example: Student practices oral responses during guided reading group

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of graphic organizers for planning speech
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports students in organizing verbal responses
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Speaks in incomplete sentences or with limited vocabulary
accommodations_modifications.example: Student fills in a beginning-middle-end chart before retelling a story

accommodations_modifications.name: Encourage peer interaction with support
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Speech patterns interfere with peer interactions
accommodations_modifications.example: Student pairs with a peer buddy for structured conversation games

accommodations_modifications.name: Positive reinforcement for communication attempts
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher praises student's effort even when speech is unclear
